node.doctext:
The following page is a "best effort" report on editor cools given over time. Since time stamps aren't stored when editor cools are given, this report looks for [Cool Man Eddie]'s "Yo, the entire node [node title], in which you have a writeup, was editor cooled. Your reward is knowing you're cooler than liquid nitrogen." message.

It should be noted that these CME messages could be deleted, so this report might not be 100% accurate. It should also be noted that if CME's notification message is ever changed, this report will no longer work. [Page of Cool] will show all editor cools, but without time stamps.

[% # in10se - This report just gets the first 500 CME messages (of which there may be some # duplicate msgs because of differing tstamps). Feel free to add paging if you want. # This report was a simplistic hack written to answer a question that the editors asked. my $rows; my $str; my $dbrow; my $queryText; my $limit = 250; $queryText = "SELECT DISTINCT msgtext,tstamp FROM message WHERE author_user=839239 AND msgtext LIKE '%editor cooled%liquid nitrogen%' ORDER BY tstamp DESC LIMIT ".$limit; $rows = $DB->{dbh}->prepare($queryText) or return $rows->errstr; $rows->execute() or return $rows->errstr; $str .= ''; my $msg; my $prevMsg = ''; my $ctr = 0; my $cssClass; while($dbrow = $rows->fetchrow_arrayref) { $msg = $$dbrow[0]; $msg =~ s/Yo, the entire node //; $msg =~ s/, in which you have a writeup, was editor cooled. Your reward is knowing you're cooler than liquid nitrogen.//; if ($msg ne $prevMsg) { $ctr++; if ($ctr % 2 == 0) { $cssClass='evenrow'; } else { $cssClass='oddrow'; } $str .= ''; } $prevMsg = $msg; } $str .= '
e2node date
'.$msg.' '.$$dbrow[1].'
'; return $str %]
